result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must obtain/maintain full-time employment beginning in mid-July.

Shall pay $3,000.00 to Victim 1.
Shall pay $2,584.00 to Victim 2.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. 
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

Shall submit a DNA sample.
If financial obligations are met, Court will consider early termination of supervision.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 7 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 7/5/22
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

3:37 PM Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Cody A. Anderson. Attorney Kurt F. Klomberg appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Atty Klomberg heard; asks if this case would be fit for restitution court. Court to consider. Atty George-Stifler heard; states defendant has made payment towards restitution and is working on getting full-time employment in order to begin a wage garnishment. Court holds discussion with defendant regarding possible new employment.  Another review hearing to be held; probation agent to appear as well. Notice of hearing handed to defendant in court. 
Probation review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Probation review hearing on December 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:01 AM Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court. Attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Cody A. Anderson. Victim rights compliance has been met. Victim is present; Court reviews charges, penalties, and plea agreement; as to count #1, def enters a plea of no contest; Court makes findings, accepts plea and finds def guilty; count #2 is DRI. Victim makes statement; sentencing arguments heard; def makes statement. Court heard;
Court imposes the following sentence:
withheld
Probation for 24 months with the following conditions:
7 days DCJ w/ h&t--to commence by July 5th at the latest. 
Maintain full time employment beginning mid July
Restitution payment of $5584 to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office
Maintain complete sobriety
No presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores
If financial obligations are met, Court will consider early termination of probation
DNA + costs
Probation review hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims; Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:36 AM Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court with attorney Alyssa F. George.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victims; Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
